newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian sugar prices extend losses on low demand.
newsitem.headline: Indian sugar prices extend losses on low demand.

text.p: Indian sugar prices on Wednesday eased on poor consumer demand while lower than expected buying as well as higher arrivals dragged prices down, dealers said.

In the ready delivery sugar S-30 fell by 20 rupees at 1,245/1,280 rupees per quintal while M-30 moved down by 5/15 rupees at 1,285/1,345 rupees per quintal. Sugar mill delivery dropped further to 1,175/1,180 rupees from 1,185/1,200 rupees per quintal.
"Arrivals in the market remained higher on the back of higher offerings by the millers," one broker said.
"Earlier millers were expecting higher demand from bulk consumers which has not materialised and now millers are offering more sugar at the retail counters," he added.
Overall volumes were low and sentiments subdued at the close of the session.
